channel.title: Beginners on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in Beginners on Some Title

item.title: Django 5 Beginners Make Simple Apps
item.description: ## Introduction Django A continuation of 4 for beginners to create simple apps. The purpose is to remove complicated things and troublesome things as much as possible, create a simplified web application, and learn the mechanism of Django. Only understand what is connected and how it moves around the backend. Implement CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) as you go, and score if you move safely. Last time I rewrote Class-based-view into Function-view and compared how the two compare to track how Django works.

item.title: [Python] Practical Beautiful Soup ~Scraping the triple odds table on the official website for boat racing~
item.description: # Purpose Data collection is a pain. I thought that I would like to analyze boat racing in the future, so as a practice of data collection Odds table of official boat racing site. Overview I can only think of a convenient language = python for scraping, so I use python3.7. Python 3.7 is called beatutiful soup ~~ It seems a little erotic ~~ It seems that the library with the name is convenient for scraping By using the beautifulsoup css selector, you can specify the location of the table without deciphering the html one by one!

item.title: Every day in Python AtCoder #44
item.description: ### Introduction Last time Solve 5 boot camp problems #44 ABC056-C Thoughts The sum of non-negative integers up to i is $\frac{1}{2}n(n+1)$}}. This sum becomes $X$ when $\frac{1}{2}n(n+1)=X$, and when solving for $n$, $n=\frac{-1\pm{ It will be \sqrt{8X+1}}}{2}$. If you add the ceil symbol to the solution of this equation, it becomes $\lceil \frac{-1\pm{\sqrt{8X+1}}}{2} \rceil$. This is the answer. import math x = int(input()) f = (-1+math.sqrt(8*x+1)) / 2 print(math.

item.title: Every day in Python AtCoder #41
item.description: ### Introduction Last time I have ABC today so I have only one question. #41 Problem Thoughts It’s a long-standing problem. When I tried to solve this time, I didn’t understand why I was having a difficult time. Since the range of the solution is small, check all with for. I have placed a flag to check if the M conditions are met. n, m = map(int,input().split()) sc = [list(map(int,input().

item.title: Learning record Part 27 (31st day)
item.description: # Learning record (31st day) Start of study: 12/7 (Sat) ~ Teaching materials: ・Miyuki Oshige “Details! Python3 Introductory Note” (Sotec, 2017): Dec 7 (Sat) to Dec 19 (Thurs) ・Progate Python course (5 courses in total): 12/19 (Thurs) to 12/21 (Sat) ・Andreas C. Müller, Sarah Guido “(Japanese title) Machine learning started with Python” (O’Reilly Japan, 2017): December 21 (Sat)-December 23 (Sat) ・Kaggle :Real or Not? NLP with Disaster Tweets ：Posted on Saturday, December 28th until Friday, January 3rd Adjustment ・Wes Mckinney “(Japanese title) Introduction to data analysis using Python” (O’Reilly Japan, 2018): 1/4 (Wed) to 1/13 (Mon) read ・Yasuyuki Saito “Deep Learning from Zero” (O’Reilly Japan, 2016): 1/15 (Wed)-1/20 (Mon) ・**François Chollet “Deep Learning with Python and Keras” (Quepe, 2018): 1/21 (Tue) ~ **

item.title: ``First time learning'' that even university students with no knowledge can do-AWS SageMaker
item.description: # My background Amazon? Ah, you know, you know, a mail order app. Not long ago, knowledge about Amazon was that much. Of course, I didn’t even know AWS. I’m ashamed as an information undergraduate student. However, as a 3rd year university student, I was introduced to the lab and learned about AWS. In addition, I am addicted to the topic “Atsuhiko Nakata’s YouTube University”, which is a hot topic in this street.
